[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Supply Chain Management (SCM) System defines requirements for functional and non-functional aspects, ensuring system performance.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: SCM provides baseline specifications to guide system development and ensure efficient supply chain operations.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: SCM integrates with existing ERP and SCM platforms for enhanced functionality.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: SCM provides a web interface designed for users at various levels of the organization.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: SCM supports standard desktop systems, mobile devices, and compatible server setups.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: SCM interacts with MS SQL databases for data processing and .NET-based application services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: SCM ensures secure communication through TCP/IP protocols.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: SCM optimizes memory management for handling data-intensive operations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: SCM operates continuously, with scheduled maintenance for system updates and performance monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: SCM offers customizable deployment options to adapt to various workflows.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: SCM integrates with third-party services, such as external databases and cloud platforms.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: SCM supports order management, inventory tracking, reporting, and customer interactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: SCM is designed for users with basic computing skills, including supply chain professionals and administrative staff.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: SCM is compatible with Microsoft operating systems and requires stable internet connectivity.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: SCM assumes availability of a Microsoft-based environment and integration with external supply chain management tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Inventory:  Goods stored for order fulfillment within SCM.
Order Management:  Process of managing customer orders in SCM.
Transaction:  Exchange of goods or data in SCM.
Supplier:  Provider of goods or services tracked in SCM.
Warehouse:  Facility for storing goods managed by SCM.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with existing ERP systems for data sharing (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support communication with external inventory systems for product tracking (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enable order creation and tracking (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall generate real-time inventory reports (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The interface shall support multiple languages for international use.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall handle up to 1,000 concurrent users without performance degradation.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store transactional data in a secure SQL database (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall use a modular architecture for scalability and future enhancements.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with ISO 27001 security standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall adhere to WCAG 2.1 for accessibility.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall dynamically scale based on user load and transaction volume (REQ-PERF-001).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional and integration testing, performance evaluations for scalability.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, system guides, and troubleshooting documents.
[SEC] 5. References: ISO 27001, WCAG 2.1, and SQL Server documentation.
